page.title: 16Swimming at Clay Cross Baths
page.content:
Each week junior children from {Stretton Handley School}go on the bus to{Sharley Park Baths}for swimming. Here are two{junior children's}views:
On the way to the swimming baths Everybody jokes and laughs While everybody all around Looks tiny and fixed to the ground The ride is smooth but sometimes bumpy The road is wide and very lumpy.
When we get to the baths we go through a smell of disinfectant and into the changing rooms. They are stuffy and smell of chlorine.When we get in the baths we have to swim six widths in the silvery, smooth liquid.We then go to the deep end of the pool and dive in.The pressure of the water makes your ears go pop so you come up and breathe a chloriney mouth full of air.
